result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter C Bradish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter C Bradish is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter C Bradish was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges subject to jail policies. May serve in Dane County on EMP.  12-14-2015 Per Judge Voigt, defendant is entitled to good time to apply to his 6 month conditional jail time.

from Atty. Covey with proposed Order

Defendant Peter C Bradish in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, 6 months jail w/Huber, Jail start date 11/3/15 at 7:00 P.M.,  may serve sentence in Dane County on E.M.P., $1,694.00 fine/costs, 30 month D.L. revocation, 30 month ignition interlock device, concurrent to Dane County Case No. 15 CT 261, $65.00 blood draw fee, AODA and comply, provide DNA Sample and $250.00 DNA Surcharge (surcharge not included w/fine/costs) if defendant has already submitted DNA does not need to do again,
Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey
Absolute sobriety while operating a motor vehicle.  Standard felony conditions.

Defendant Peter C Bradish in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to dismiss 15CT89.  Case15CT89 dismissed by court.   In 15CF316 reading of complaint waived.  $1000.00 signature bond.  Standard felony conditions.   Absolute sobriety while operating a motor vehicle.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Not guilty plea entered by court.  Atty Covey requested a new pretrial and return date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:40 pm.  Return date scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
